alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:10AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jackson and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Scott, Rock Island and Muscatine Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Whiteside, Rock Island and Clinton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, Water affects several homes in the Frentress Lake area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to 21.7 feet Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
